title: Detroit Red Wings - classic ice hockey jersey lettering
content:
Hi,

I'm trying to identify (as close as possible) the typefaces used in the attached visuals. I understand that these may be custom but the closest equivalent would be very helpful.

Looking to identify the "DETROIT" on the front of the jersey, numbers on the back, "player name - DATSYUK" and "C" and "A" on the sleeves.

Thanks for any assistance with this.

Josh

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140329070345im_/http:/typophile.com/files/0407-det14wc-jersey_4705.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140329070345im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wc2014zetterberg_5836.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140329070345im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Redwings4_3569.jpg)
author: jjdewtt

comments.content:
Similar to "DETROIT 40": **[Paul Lloyd's Shrewsbury](http://web.archive.org/web/20140329070345/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lloyd/index.htm)**  
"DATSYUK": **[LHF Old Block Cond Med](http://web.archive.org/web/20140329070345/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Letterhead&ffam=LHFOldBlockCondMed%20-%20Regular&fid=60bb477a75461b4099844d414c1920e3&fsize=60&text=DATSYUK&fit=1)** from Letterhead looks like a perfect match  
It's probably easy to use **LHF Old Block** for /C & /A
